result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Marie Shelander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09-27-2018 Judge Michael J. Hanrahan--The defendant's request for release privileges is granted. Defendant may be released for the following:  Elder care/caregiver and child care
Consecutive
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/02/2016 @ 1:30pm, Br-24

miscConds.notes:
EACH COUNT: Provide DNA sample. Pay the DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at ZERO.

- No Contact with firearms. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction f a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- NO CONTACT with victim M.B., unless approved by the agent. Court grants third party contact for purpose of time with the child as approved by the agent and in compliance with any Children's Court Order.

- Parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant.

Defendant Lisa Marie Shelander in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail refund packet

Defendant Lisa Marie Shelander in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Lisa Marie Shelander in custody.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. State complied with victim notification. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, Michael B., and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 42 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 90 days (on count 1) in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim M.B. unless approved by the agent. Court grants third party contact for purpose of time with the child as approved by the agent and in compliance with any Children's Court order. 
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay the DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Restitution set at ZERO.

**Bail on deposit to be returned to whomever posted it**

Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Probation Review Hearing in Branch 24.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Lisa Marie Shelander in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Lisa Marie Shelander in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
